Name: Heuristic Reasoning - PE
Text: First, I need to look through the event log table and look for which cases have long resolution times. The resolution time for each ticket would be the time from when the ticket was assigned to the agent through to closure. Since all the timestamps are given, maybe I can compute the duration between each event and the ticket being resolved. Looking at the data: Each ticket will have several events. For each case, lets see the total time from Receive to Close.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Like Case 101: the reception at 08:00, triage at 08:10, assigning Level1 at 08:20, investigating at 09:00, resolving at 10:00, closing at 10:15. So total time from 08:00 to 10:15 is 2h15m approximately.

Name: Backtracking - PE
Text: For case 102 receives at 08:05, triage at 08:30, assign to agent at 09:00, investigate 11:30, Escalate to Level2 Agent, resolve at 20240302 09:00, close at 09:15. Wait let me check entries again. Looking at case 102s events. Wait, maybe I need to list all events for each case. Looking again.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - NE
Text: For example, Case 102s events: Receive at 08:05, Triage at 08:30, Assign at 09:00, then 11:30 Escalate, Investigate at 14:00 on 0301, Resolve at 09:00 on 0302, Close at 09:15. the total time from 08:05 to 14:00 is 5h55m but actually longer.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Case 103: Receive at 08:10, Triage 08:15, Assign 08:30, Investigate 08:45, Resolve 09:15, Close 09:30. total duration for case 103: from 08:10 to 09:30 is 1h20m. Thats shorter.

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Case 104: Receive 08:20, Triage 09:00, Assign 09:30, Investigate 13:00, Resolve 0800 on 0302, Close 08:30. Case 105: Receive 08:25, Triage 08:35, Assign 09:00, Investigate 09:10, Escalate 10:00, Investigate 14:00 on 0302, Resolve 09:00 on 0303, Close 09:30.

Name: Hypothesis Generation - PE
Text: longer resolution times could be due to cases with escalations, long investigation time, or projects that go through multiple agents.

Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: determine root causes: possible factors include escalation, waiting for further processing, lack of priority, multistep investigation, agent availability. these are due to escalations requiring time between agents, long investigation phases needing skill, or perhaps other delays in human factors.

Name: Abductive Reasoning - IND
Text: the conclusion here is that case102 and perhaps others with longer duration might be in categories where delays occur because of escalations, extended investigation needs, or agent switching leads to duplication. Hence, possible root causes, leading to recommendations like prioritizing and streamlining processes, or increasing staff with faster resolution expertise.
